pageProps.body:
Hackathon

Find Hackathons (Ranked)

  1. DevPost
    1. Pretty much the status quo
  2. https://pinnacle.us.org/
    1. You already know
  3. Major League Hacking
    1. Not the biggest fan tbh
  4. Hack Club
    1. Curated List for High Schoolers
  5. DevFolio
    1. Devpost wannabe
  6. http://hackathonsnear.me/
    1. Might be useful after COVID for in person
  7. https://www.hackathon.io/
    1. Big list, a bunch of spam

Cool Existing Ideas

  1. https://www.producthunt.com/
  2. Hackathon - A collection of Boilerplates and Resources for Hackathons - (hackathon) (opensourcelibs.com)
  3. API Directory | ProgrammableWeb

Interesting API’s

  1. https://finnhub.io/
    1. Free Stock/Currency API
  2. https://www.quiverquant.com/
    1. Ask me for free api
  3. https://apilist.fun/
  4. https://github.com/lavie/Awesome-APIs
  5. https://github.com/public-apis/public-apis

Data Sources

  1. https://www.kaggle.com
  2. https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/
  3. https://www.datasetlist.com/
  4. https://datasetsearch.research.google.com/
    1. Dataset search tool
  5. https://dataverse.org/

Deployment Tools

  1. https://www.netlify.com/
  2. https://www.pyth onanywhere.com/
  3. Heroku
  4. Google app engine
  5. Open Shift

Wireframing

  1. Moqups
  2. Basalmiq
  3. Invision
  4. Axure
  5. OmniGraffle

Website Creation

  1. Bootstrap
    1. https://getbootstrap.com
    2. https://startbootstrap.com/
    3. https://codyhouse.co/
    4. http://bootsnipp.com/
  2. https://reactjs.org/
    1. Next.js by Vercel - The React Framework (nextjs.org)
  3. http://ianlunn.github.io/Hover/
  4. Free domain names
    1. https://education.github.com/pack
    2. MLH monthly codes

Backend Stuff

  1. https://firebase.google.com/
  2. http://fenixwebserver.com/
  3. https://www.mongodb.com/
    1. https://studio3t.com/download/
  4. Whatever database is sponsering
  5. https://fastapi.tiangolo.com/
  6. https://flask.palletsprojects.com

ML Cloud Training

  1. Free
    1. https://colab.research.google.com
    2. https://www.kaggle.com/
    3. Whatever service the hackathon gives credits for
  2. Paid
    1. https://cloud.google.com/
    2. https://aws.amazon.com/
    3. https://azure.microsoft.com

Cool ML Stuff

  1. Essential
    1. https://pandas.pydata.org/
    2. https://numpy.org/
    3. https://www.tensorflow.org/
    4. https://pytorch.org/
    5. https://scikit-learn.org/stable/
  2. Visualization
    1. https://matplotlib.org/
    2. https://seaborn.pydata.org/
    3. https://plotly.com/
    4. holoviz
  3. Newer tools
    1. https://github.com/facebookresearch/AugLy
      • Data augmentation library
    2. https://juliapackages.com/c/machine-learning
    3. https://kobra.dev/ (for beginners)
  4. NLP
    1. https://beta.openai.com/
    2. https://huggingface.co/
  5. Evolutionary Algorithms (just something I like)
    1. https://neat-python.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
    2. https://sharpneat.sourceforge.io/
    3. https://deap.readthedocs.io/en/master/
  6. Generative Stuff
    1. https://github.com/lucidrains/deep-daze
    2. https://github.com/NVlabs/stylegan2
  7. Recreate Cutting Edge Models
    1. https://paperswithcode.com/
    2. https://keras.io/
      • Prob best framework to recreate papers
  8. Miscellaneous
    1. https://gym.openai.com/
    2. https://julialang.org/

Hardware

  1. Computationally intensive tasks
    1. https://developer.nvidia.com/embedded/jetson-nano-developer-kit
    2. https://www.raspberrypi.org/
  2. Lower level stuff
    1. https://www.arduino.cc/
  3. General resource
    1. https://hackaday.io/
  4. Sample Projects
    1. https://create.arduino.cc/projecthub
    2. https://projects.raspberrypi.org/en/projects
    3. https://github.com/thibmaek/awesome-raspberry-pi
    4. https://developer.nvidia.com/embedded/community/jetson-projects

Blockchain/Distributed Ledger (Meh)

  1. https://github.com/austintgriffith/scaffold-eth
    1. Fast Deploy Kit
  2. https://dev.to/dabit3/the-complete-guide-to-full-stack-ethereum-development-3j13
  3. https://github.com/wighawag/jolly-roger
    1. Svelte based

Testing/Demoing

  1. https://ngrok.com/
  2. https://pitcherific.com/
    1. Prez stuff
  3. https://openideo-resources.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/production/assets/1519.pdf
    1. Sample Slides
  4. https://medium.com/@dustin/stock-photos-that-dont-suck-62ae4bcbe01b
    1. Stock Photos That Don't Suck

Other

  1. https://justgetflux.com/
    1. Fix eye strain at night
  2. https://github.com/anishathalye/gave
    1. Cool judging software
  3. https://nyhackathons.com/tools/

noteIndex.title: Home

note-this-site-is-no-longer-being-update.text: Note: This site is no longer being updated

noteIndex.body:
## Adam's Knowledge Base

![Picture of me](/assets/images/adam.jpg){max-width: 150px, display: block, margin: 0}

## About Me

I am an undergraduate at **The** Ohio State University studying Computer Science & Engineering. I love cutting edge technology, especially when used it's for Automation, Startups, and Data Analytics.

Some other hobbies of mine include competing on the [OSU Club Wrestling Team](https://ncwa.net/teams/osu), coordinating events for the [Big Data Analytical Association](https://bdaaosu.org/), and whatever [[I'm currently working on|what-im-doing]]. I'm always looking for cool stuff to work on so please reach out if you're making of learning something interesting.

## What This Site Is

One big issue I have is that I tend to find a lot of great resources for learning a topic, but lose the, due to disorganization. To combat this pesky issue, I created this site as sort of a second brain to store things of interest. This site contains everything from my class notes to vim guides. If you would like anything added, feel free to send me an email.

## Links

- **[Github](https://github.com/aglucky)**
- **[Resume](/assets/gluck_resume.pdf)**
- **[LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/adam-gluck-111a2a174/)**
- **Email: Adam.gluck10@gmail.com**

## Note: This site is no longer being updated
